purpose.summary: This copybook defines the 01 PAUTBPCB level structure for an IMS Database Program Communication Block (DBPCB). It includes fields for database name, segment level, PCB status, processing options, segment name, key feedback name, number of sensitive segments, and the key feedback area. Used in IMS DL/I programs to pass control information to and receive feedback from IMS database calls.
purpose.business_context: Supports IMS DL/I database access in batch or online IMS applications for segment retrieval, insertion, replacement, and deletion operations.

inputs.name: PAUT-PCB-PROCOPT
inputs.description: Processing options set by the application program to specify the type of DL/I call (e.g., GU for Get Unique, GNP for Get Next, ISRT for Insert)

inputs.name: PAUT-DBDNAME
inputs.description: Database name, typically predefined in the PSB and referenced or confirmed by the application

outputs.name: PAUT-PCB-STATUS
outputs.description: Two-byte status code returned by IMS indicating success (spaces) or error conditions after DL/I call

outputs.name: PAUT-SEG-LEVEL
outputs.description: Segment level of the retrieved or affected segment, populated by IMS on successful calls

outputs.name: PAUT-SEG-NAME
outputs.description: Name of the segment retrieved or affected, populated by IMS

outputs.name: PAUT-KEYFB-NAME
outputs.description: Key feedback name or length indicator populated by IMS

outputs.name: PAUT-NUM-SENSEGS
outputs.description: Number of sensitive segments for the PCB, populated by IMS

outputs.name: PAUT-KEYFB
outputs.description: Key feedback area containing concatenated key fields of the retrieved segment

business_rules.description: Application must set valid processing option codes in PAUT-PCB-PROCOPT before issuing a DL/I call
business_rules.logic_summary: Field defined as PIC X(04) to hold IMS PROCOPT values dictating call type (e.g., K for key, P for parentage)

business_rules.description: After DL/I call, application must check PAUT-PCB-STATUS for success (blanks) or error codes
business_rules.logic_summary: Field defined as PIC X(02) receives IMS status; non-blank indicates error requiring handling

error_handling.action: Application program logic evaluates status and takes remedial action such as abend or retry
